popover.pricing_info: Artifacts are priced based on the Ethereum network fees at the time of collecting.
popover.network_fees: Network fees (Gas fees) are an essential component of securing and running decentralized blockchains.
popover.artist_reward: The cost to store and secure the object on the network is mirrored as compensation to the artist, creating a direct link between network value and creator reward.
popover.mint_more_info: Mints of more than one don't increase the Ethereum fee, resulting in higher artist compensation.

collections_overview.no_collections: It looks like you haven't deployed any collections.
collections_overview.no_collections_other: It looks like this account hasn't deployed any collections.

note.start: Note: This should be a small file, preferably an SVG like
note.end: If it is larger than what we can store within one transaction, the token creation will be split up into multiple transactions.

token.blocks_ago: just now | one block ago | {blocks} blocks ago

alert_new.title: Create New Collection
alert_new.text: Note this just creates the collection smart contract. You'll be able to mint individual artifacts within the collection after collection deployment.

note.start: Note: This should be a small file, preferably a simple SVG like
note.end: Try to make it less than 10kb.

deploy_method.note_create: Deploying a completely independent Mint collection means creating a new contract instance with its own unique code, which is more expensive upfront. This initial deployment cost is higher than that of a proxy clone, but it offers a small saving on each individual mint or interaction. This is because each call is directed straight to the contract without the intermediary steps required by a proxy, reducing gas usage for repetitive transactions.
deploy_method.note_clone: When using a proxy contract clone, the deployment cost is lower since it reuses the logic of the Mint collection contract template. The proxy contract points to the original contract for its code, making deployment cheaper than a fresh contract creation. However, this setup may lead to slightly higher costs on individual interactions, like minting, as each call involves additional steps to interact with the proxy.
